location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 1078/44 'United States Minister, Baghdad: Tour of Arab Coast of Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 19; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence regarding a tour of the Arabian coast by Loy W Henderson, United States Minister to Iraq, and his interactions with the Political Agents at Bahrain, Kuwait and Muscat, and with Said bin Taimur, Sultan of Muscat and Oman. As well as Mr Henderson, the primary correspondents are: Government of India; India Office; Foreign Office; British Legation, Baghdad; Political Agency, Muscat.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
